call think about our experiences and educational institutions in and realized that an event like this is a pretty unusual occurrence or we can just come together in what is appropriately Ben Ben call to Research Forum for American Indians were we where we eat without having to defend the legitimate legitimacy of the kinds of concerns and questions and topics that we are concerned with a before any any kind of a wider audience so we can come together and talk to each other that that doesn't mean we all think alike doesn't mean that we all are going to approach any given you the same way about that we can really come into this this room in this space with a sense of community of mutual understanding and respect and concern and have a meeting for conversation that we can say something to talk about their own specific projects and also have a chance to learn from each other and I think one of the

real ways in which the educational system fails us is when it creates a competitive environment that says that your worth is dependent on your GPA or you or the comments that the teacher writes on your paper or how you compare the inner with other people we know I think from a variety of different kinds of backgrounds that that kind of basis for human worth is not is not real solid it it's it's actually contributes to a lot of the kinds of problems that we see in our society and in our own lives so I would just kind of call that to our attention this morning that we can kind of come to this with a different frame of mine with a different understanding about what a human being is and what the importance of human creativity is that doesn't mean that we can't challenge each other that we can't push each other to think about issues in ways that we haven't looked at I know I want to be a challenge time I'm unfortunately not going to be here for the whole day I go
